summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued to Leslie Groff by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding their appearance on July 24, 2019, to testify and produce documents in an investigation into alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and related statutes. The document includes an advice of rights and a request to keep the subpoena confidential.

persons.name: Leslie Groff
persons.context: Individual commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce documents related to an investigation into alleged violations of federal sex trafficking laws.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the subpoena and the accompanying letter requesting confidentiality.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance of Leslie Groff
events.description: Leslie Groff is commanded to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Foley Square, New York, to testify and give evidence.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The subpoena is dated and issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office, initiating the formal command for testimony and document production.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Leslie Groff was subpoenaed to testify before a federal grand jury on July 24, 2019, in the Southern District of New York.

The investigation involves alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421 (transportation for prostitution), 2422 (coercion and enticement), 2423 (transportation of minors), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that Groff voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The subpoena includes an 'Advice of Rights' informing the recipient of their right against self-incrimination and right to counsel.
The document is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman, indicating high-level federal involvement in the investigation.
